title: How Many Calories Are in Vodka?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in vodka per standard shot, including full nutrition breakdown, equivalents, and tweaks for different proofs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Vodka?
assumptions: 80-proof (40% ABV) vodka; standard serving of 1.5 fl oz (44 ml); distilled spirit, no mixers.
disclaimer: Calories vary by proof, brand, and serving size; alcohol content affects totals. Consult labels for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One standard 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof vodka contains about 97 kcal, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of vodka?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for a 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof vodka.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Plain vodka has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars—all calories from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories; e.g., 100-proof adds ~24 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: Calories in vodka vs. other spirits?
faqs.a: Similar for gin or rum at same proof; vodka is ~97 kcal per 1.5 oz shot.
Yes, plain vodka has zero carbs, but mixers can add them—stick to diet sodas.
